awd_titl_txt: Travel: Student Travel Support for IEEE/ACM International Conferences on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2022) and Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2022)
awd_abstract_narration:
The UCC 2022 and BDCAT 2022 conferences will provide a premier international platform for researchers in both academic and industry to present new discoveries, developments, research results, as well as the latest trends and new challenges in cloud/edge computing, and big-data computing and technologies. The conferences, to be held at the Marriott-Portland Downtown Waterfront in Portland, Oregon, in December 6-9, 2022, is organized by a leading group of experts in cloud computing and big data technologies and will bring together researchers, developers and users from academia, industry, laboratories, and commerce to discuss recent advances and trends in cloud computing and big data technologies.   

This is a proposal to fund students’ traveling to participate in the conference to engage deeply with the UCC/BDCAT research community.  The UCC/BDCAT student participation program provides a comprehensive means for students to improve their overall research skills and planning, beyond presenting posters and papers.  The conference will run specific student-centric sessions during the conference, mainly scheduled in parallel or after the end of the regular sessions, including a Doctoral Symposium, and an NSF REU Symposium, which will provide rich opportunities for student attendees to interact with peers and senior researchers. This year for the first time, UCC/BDCAT welcomes the student-focused program, Symposium for Undergraduate Research in Data Science, Systems, and Security (NSF REU Symposium), which will greatly enrich the UCC/BDCAT student programs, bringing undergraduate researchers to the event to present their research work in cloud computing and big data science and technologies.

This award reflects NSF's statutory mission and has been deemed worthy of support through evaluation using the Foundation's intellectual merit and broader impacts review criteria.
org_dir_long_name: Directorate for Computer and Information Science and Engineering

por.por_cntn:
The International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC) and the International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT) are collocated conferences which take place annually in December, sponsored by both IEEE and ACM. These conferences aim to provide a platform for researchers in both academic and industry to present new discoveries, developments, results, as well as the latest trends in cloud/edge computing, and big data computing and technologies. Attending such a premium international conference is an excellent opportunity for students to interact with peers and researchers in the field. The conference had more than 120 participants from 50+ locations worldwide. 

 

This NSF grant funded 26 students to attend the 15th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Utility and Cloud Computing (UCC 2022), and the 9th IEEE/ACM International Conference on Big Data Computing, Applications and Technologies (BDCAT 2022), which were held in the from December 6th through December 9th of 2022. Among the 26 awardees, 5 were female students, and 13 were undergraduate students. Awardees were selected via a rigorous application and review process by an award committee consisting of 5 faculty members. During the conference, the awardees were offered opportunities to interact with conference chairs, researchers, and peer students through various of activities, including the REU Symposium, poster session, reception, banquet, and other networking events. The awardees were also mentored on various topics and provided opportunities to volunteer at the conferences. This project has impact in stimulating students’ enthusiasm in conducting research in big data computing and cloud computing, providing opportunities for the students to interact with top researchers in the field. The awardees were asked to provide feedback via a post-conference survey, and the results indicated they gained enhanced experience at the conferences because of the NSF grant.  

 

 


Last Modified: 12/04/2023
Modified by: Xinghui Zhao
